definition: lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck
to fish up/to dredge up
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Politicians use the "right" making money, black and white confluence, Living and sharing interests.
sentences.chinese: 政治人物藉“权”捞钱，黑白合流，利益共生互享。

sentences.english: It looks so easy that he just sits there and shovels in the profits.
sentences.chinese: 看上去那么容易他只是坐在那儿大笔捞钱。

sentences.english: His father had shown him the ropes.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲用实际行动向他揭示了捞钱的决窍。

sentences.english: Some government departments try in a hundred and one ways to collect money by inventing different names.
sentences.chinese: 第二句说有些政府部门千方百计巧立名目来捞钱。

sentences.english: They’re not going to let this opportunity get away from them.
sentences.chinese: 因此他们不会放任任捞钱的机会从身边溜走的。

definition: (coll.) to grab money/to rake in money
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
to get money/to accumulate money
to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
to collect money/to raise funds (for charity)
to make extra money
to profiteer/to gain some underhand advantage
dirty money
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to swindle/to cheat
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to be corrupt/corruption/to embezzle
speculation and profiteering (idiom); buying and selling on speculation
to earn
to buy a title/to use wealth to acquire office
to make money
